issue.title: Support for template of template

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body:
`doctrine/persistence` defines a generic `ClassMetadata` interface, and its generic `ClassMetadataFactory`. Templating `ClassMetadataFactory::getMetadataFor()` does not seem possible:

https://psalm.dev/r/0ff07df695

I would expect no errors.

body:
Mmh, this goes further than that:
https://psalm.dev/r/edaea88e00

In this example, it does not detect that the param changed from string to int. I thought @method were ignored when there was a real method upper, but that's not the case as the method returns stdClass instead of int.
This means:
- There is no covariance/contravariance checks with @method
- @method can override the return type but not the params types

issue.title: [Enhancement] Emit an error when phpdoc is impossible

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body:
https://psalm.dev/r/af5065a4c0

Given that `bar` has a native return type of `string`, shouldn't psalm be able to emit an error that the phpdoc is invalid? I'm thinking that phpdoc should only become the source of truth if there are no native typehints or the typehints are castable to each other..

issue.title: MethodSignatureMismatch when extending class with variadic @method

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body: If https://psalm.dev/r/935510dd68 is fine, I'd expect https://psalm.dev/r/2c63f8d3b7 to also be fine. Might be an issue with when annotations are realised?

issue.title: Would expect `MethodSignatureMismatch`

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body:
Probably mis-understanding something, as usual. Apologies if so.
I would expect psalm to give a `MethodSignatureMismatch` error here?
https://psalm.dev/r/c4bfb387bd

issue.title: Interface violation isn't reported if method is specified in docblock

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body:
https://psalm.dev/r/a50dc23247

There should be an error on line 10, because the implementation violates interface `Foo` contract.

issue.title: Method annotation fixes

labels.name: release:fix
labels.description: The PR will be included in 'Fixes' section of the release notes

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body:
Fixes #5786 
Fixes #3871
Fixes #4546 
Fixes #5990
Also fixes this https://psalm.dev/r/edaea88e00, where an extend with an `@method` silently overwrites the parent return type
